intro: Verticordia serrata, commonly known as the serrated featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathland and woodland habitats. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are highly attractive to nectar-feeding birds and insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
